ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 2.48 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You should not be anxious for the success or failure of the attempt you are making. Suppose you are working in a firm selling something. You go out and sincerely work. Suppose one day you get business worth 100,000 dollars, and another day you don't get any business. It doesn't matter, because your connection with the master is there and so you get your salary. When the profit is 100,000 dollars, you don't expect any profit, and when there is no business, there is no loss on your part. Siddhy-asiddhyoh.

I am going to my office to earn some money, because without money, my household affairs could not go on. I am thinking, 'This money is required, otherwise God's service will be stopped.' So while earning money in my office, my God consciousness is there. Therefore, even while earning, whatever the process may be, you are yoga-sthah, situated in yoga. You get some money and go to the market. You are thinking, 'Oh, this is a very nice thing. It can be offered to Lord Kṛṣṇa.' Just like sometimes you bring some fruit for me, thinking, out of your love, 'Swamiji will eat this and he will like it.' Out of love, you think of Swamiji, and Swamiji is thought of because he is in relation with God. So this is God consciousness. It is just like electricity. Anything connected with the powerhouse is surcharged with electricity.
But if you mold your life in such a way that always, twenty-four hours a day, you are in meditation—that is the platform of yoga-sthah kuru karmāņi.

Because my body is dedicated to the service of the Lord, if I don't eat sufficiently to keep my body fit, I won't be able to work. In this way, your eating is also God consciousness. Your sleeping is also God consciousness.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.3 in Nairobi in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So when we realize that 'I am trying to accumulate so many things, but Kṛṣṇa is taking them away,' then why don't I surrender to Kṛṣṇa so that He may not take away my position? That is siddhi, that 'I am not independent. I am trying independently, but it is not possible. I am dependent. I am an eternal servant of Kṛṣṇa.' That is self-realization.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam 7.16 in Hyderabad in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: By the evolutionary process, the conditioned soul transmigrates from aquatic life to plant life, then insect life, then reptile life, then bird life, then beast life, then the human form of life, then civilized human life, and then a human body born in Bharata-varṣa. To be born in this land of Bharata-varṣa is the highest developed life by the evolutionary process.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 2.39 in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Because we are subordinate, we must act according to the direction of the master, or the Supreme. That is called buddhi-yoga. When you act according to the direction of the Supreme, Kṛṣṇa, or His representative, it is called buddhi-yoga.

Bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam: always trying to render some service to the Lord. How? Prīti-pūrvakam: 'with love and faith.' Not that 'Oh, I have to do it? All right, let me do it.' No. 'Oh, I have to do it? Let me do it nicely.' Unless there is love, you cannot do anything nicely.

This person has surrendered to Kṛṣṇa after many, many births. If that is the ultimate goal, why shouldn't I surrender immediately? That is buddhi-yoga. 'Why shall I wait for many, many births?' That is buddhi-yoga, intelligent yoga.
As soon as one comes to the point of serving Kṛṣṇa with love, even without any understanding, it will act just like fire. Without making an analytical study of fire, if you touch it, it will act.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 2.40 in Mayapur in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you simply offer your obeisances before the Deity, you will undoubtedly make progress.

Foolish persons think that they are very much advanced and so they have no need to attend ārati, or play the mṛdaṅga or cymbals, but that is not a fact. So many items are given by the ācāryas. If not this, you do this, you do that—hundreds of items. Take any one of them and you'll be benefited. This is arcana-mārga.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda room conversation on Bg 2.41 in Tokyo in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu's mission is prithivīte āche yata nagarādi grāma: 'you must preach this cult.' One who is doing this is really a devotee. He may not be a very successful preacher that doesn't matter. Because he is doing this, he is a first-class devotee. That is a real follower. What his predecessor has ordered must be done at any risk. It doesn't matter whether it is being done nicely or not. Because he is attempting to do this, it is sufficient. That very attempt will make him successful. This is the principle. Vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda letter referring to Bg 2.41 in Bombay in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The real ocean of mercy is Kṛṣṇa and it is the duty of the spiritual master to tell his disciple to come to this ocean and be happy. I am trying my best, and if you try to follow, surely you will benefit.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture in New Vrndāvana in 1969 referring to Bg 2.41
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Nārada's instructions for Bg 2.41

statements.statement: Vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru-nandana: 'Those who are on this path are resolute in purpose, and their aim is one.' If that one is the source of everything, one should take that one.

speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

ref: While lecturing on Nārada's instructions to Śrīla Vyāsadeva in the First Canto of Śrimad-Bhāgavatam in New Vrndāvana in 1969, referred to Bg verse 2.41
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Nārada's instructions for Bg 2.41

statements.statement: Vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru nandana: "Those who are on this path are resolute in purpose, and their aim is one." If that one is the source of everything, one should take that one.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verse 2.47 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you don't give engagement to the consciousness on the consciousness plane, then naturally consciousness will act through the body.

One should not think, "Because I am not this body, I shall cease working." No. If you stop working, then your idle brain will become a devil's workshop. Therefore the Lord says, "The technique of acting on the spiritual platform is that you have a right to act according to your position," but mã phaleșu kadācana: "you should not desire to enjoy the fruits of your activities."

Our mind is so inclined that if I cannot enjoy the fruits of my activities, then I am disinclined. There is an English proverb: "Proprietorship turns sand into gold." A person working on his own account can turn sand into gold, but a person working on another's account will be slow. "Why shall I work so hard? The result will be enjoyed by someone else." But here the Lord says, "You cannot stop your work, nor can you enjoy the fruits of your activities." That is work on the spiritual plane.
If your fruitive results are offered to the Supreme Lord, they will be distributed to everyone. That is the spiritual State.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verse 2.48 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.49-50 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Buddhi-yoga means devotional service to the Lord. So you have to do everything based on the criterion of buddhi-yoga, or devotional service to the Lord. That is the technique. Dūreṇa hy avaram karma buddhi-yogāt. You have to use your intelligence, "Whether I am doing this on the platform of pure consciousness, or on the platform of this body?" Don't do any work which you cannot do in God consciousness.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.52-53 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Therefore the whole thing depends upon how to adjust ourselves to that supreme consciousness. If while performing all the religious rituals very nicely and perfectly, we fail to dovetail ourselves with the supreme consciousness, then all our labor for performing these rituals becomes only a labor of love. It has not produced anything substantial.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.55-58 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The first symptom of a self-realized soul is that he doesn't make any plans for his prosperity. I should not make any plan independently, but I must accept the standard plan which is coming directly from the supreme consciousness through a channel.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verse 2.59 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We have to learn how to see the beauty of spiritual life, and then we will be able to refrain from material activities. We have to be always, cent percent, engaged in spiritual activities. That should be the program of our life.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.60-61 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you simply chant the holy names of the Lord, then everything will by and by come to you automatically.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.60–61 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Without penance and without sacrifice, nobody has attained spiritual perfection. So we require some sort of penance. That penance is to not engage our senses in the process of sense gratification.

The motto of our life: 'I shall not do anything for my sense satisfaction, but I shall do everything for the satisfaction of the Supreme.' That penance, that sacrifice, will make me perfectly spiritualized so that my life becomes perfect.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.67–68 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you want to control the senses, then you first have to control the tongue. Then you will be able to control the other senses very easily. Give the tongue the engagement of chanting Hare Kṛṣṇa and tasting Kṛṣṇa prasādam and then you'll find that your other senses are already controlled. This is the key to controlling the senses, but if you allow the tongue indulgence, you'll never be able to control the other senses. This is the secret of controlling the senses.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.41 — Disappearance Day Lecture on Śrīla Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvatī Ṭhākura by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Disappearance Day Lecture on Śrīla Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvatī Ṭhākura

statements.statement: If we strictly try to serve the spiritual master, his order, then Kṛṣṇa will give us all facilities. That is the secret. Although I never thought that there was any possibility.
We should try to carry out the specific instruction of the spiritual master very rigidly, without caring for our personal benefit or loss.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.59 — Room Conversation with Śrīla Prabhupāda, New Mayapur, France, 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: In the spiritual world, the service of the Lord is so pleasing that they can neglect sense pleasure. That is spiritual world.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.4–5 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Simply rejecting will not help you. You must have positive engagement in Kṛṣṇa consciousness.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.6–8 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You cannot cheat others. Simply for Kṛṣṇa's satisfaction you can beg from others.
One who cannot become cent percent engaged, then all right, become fifty percent, twenty-five percent, or one percent engaged. Give something for Kṛṣṇa. Don't be a miser.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.36–40 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Engage your senses in Kṛṣṇa conscious activities. Then lust will have no place to attack your senses, or sit on your senses. Engage your mind in Kṛṣṇa. Immediately, lust from the mind will go away. Similarly, apply your intelligence, how to work in Kṛṣṇa consciousness. These are the processes.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.36–37 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Melbourne
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: These boys and girls are engaged in the service of the Lord. They are not ordinary boys. Their reactions of sinful life are finished. Therefore they are so steadily engaged, twenty-four hours, from early in the morning, four o'clock. That is the sign that they are freed from the reactions of all sinful activities. This is the proof.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.41–43 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Intelligent take to the practice of yoga by intelligently trying to control the senses. But as soon as you come to the spiritual platform, automatically these things are done because your senses, mind, and intelligence are occupied by Kṛṣṇa consciousness.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.42 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Nairobi, 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: He came here for everyone, because he loves everyone.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.42 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, London, 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: As my mind is absorbed in some subject matter, my bodily symptoms will appear.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.5–9 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Bombay, 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you simply read the Kṛṣṇa book, although it looks like a story, you will become delivered from the clutches of the repetition of birth and death.

The people who are very seriously reading the Kṛṣṇa book and trying to understand Kṛṣṇa will understand. Kṛṣṇa is very kind. As soon as someone begins reading the Kṛṣṇa book with a little faith and adherence, Kṛṣṇa will be very much pleased.
You don't have to search for Kṛṣṇa—He's already within you. Simply you have to become a little serious.
If you are a serious devotee, if you are in love with Kṛṣṇa, then teṣāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam: Kṛṣṇa will reveal Himself to you.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.5–9 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The Lord is very much anxious about saintly persons who have sacrificed everything for His service and so are very, very dear to Him.
The Lord cannot tolerate it when someone misbehaves with a sādhu. Although a sādhu tolerates all insults, the Lord will never tolerate it if a sādhu is insulted or threatened.
There is special protection for the person who is a devotee who is always thinking of Kṛṣṇa in Kṛṣṇa consciousness.
When we acquire transcendental senses, we will see Kṛṣṇa through the Bhagavad-gītā. The Bhagavad-gītā is Kṛṣṇa. Bhagavad-gītā is not different from Kṛṣṇa.
If we chant this vibration of transcendental sound with devotion and attention, it is the highest type of meditation and yoga. And it is very easy.

So anyone who understands this fact, that Kṛṣṇa is not different from the sound Kṛṣṇa, that Kṛṣṇa is not different from the Bhagavad-gītā, and that Kṛṣṇa is not different from anything which is connected with Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.10 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Vṛndāvana, 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Always think of Kṛṣṇa, man-manāḥ. If you simply think of Kṛṣṇa, if you simply chant the Hare Kṛṣṇa names, you remain man-mayā.
It is understood that those who are thinking of Kṛṣṇa have taken shelter of Kṛṣṇa.
Suffering is there and so why not suffer for Kṛṣṇa?

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.11 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Leadership and Personal Conduct

statements.statement: The leader should be such that he will make the persons following him happy and prosperous.
I have a particular lust within me, and when I find somebody corroborating with that particular lust, I accept him as a leader. That is my position. Therefore I do not follow anyone's leadership.

If you agree to follow the leadership of Kṛṣṇa then proportionately as you follow, you will become perfect. If you follow one percent, you will become one percent perfect. If you follow twenty-five percent, you will become twenty-five percent perfect. And if you follow cent-percent, you will become cent percent perfect.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.14–15 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So accept Kṛṣṇa as your son and He'll be the most obedient son, just as He was playing the part before Yaśodā. Similarly, accept Kṛṣṇa as your husband or lover. You'll never be frustrated. That is the whole philosophy. Whatever desire you have, you can establish a relationship with Kṛṣṇa and you'll be perfectly happy, and never be cheated.
